Frank L. Engel

remote sensing, data analysis, python, method development

Resume

About Me

Geographer and researcher with 10+ years of experience in developing new tools, technology, and apps using remote sensing to solve real-world problems. Very familiar with standard software design practices, operational deployment of technology and hardware, and providing practical training. Passionate about good project management and clear communication through scientific publications, documentation, and other media.

Experience

U.S. Geological Survey

Geographer, Hydrologic Remote Sensing Branch | January 2022 - Present

As part of the Technology Development and Transfer Team, I work to create new software tools and methods to solve water resource issues.

  • Project Manager of the National Imagery Management System (NIMS), a cloud infrastructure for ingesting and displaying imagery from hundreds of cameras located at USGS gaging locations around the nation.
  • Developed non-contact streamflow methods and software using image velocimetry.
  • Certified and experiences uncrewed aerial system (UAS) pilot.
  • Recognized Subject Matter Expert in the use and deployment of cameras for image velocimetry gaging techniques.
project management software development uas python aws

U.S. Geological Survey

Geographer, Oklahoma-Texas Water Science Center | June 2017 - December 2021

Operationally focused scientist working on water resource problems nationally and at the local level.

  • Conducted novel near-shore hydroacoustic deployments to understand beach sand replenishment and sediment transport.
  • Developed flood models for the Texas Hillcountry to inform the public about flood risk.
  • Mapped active volcanic activity with UAS as part of the 2018 KÄ«lauea Volcano Erruption response.
hydrualics hydroacoustics sediment transport h&h modeling uas

U.S. Geological Survey

Geographer, Illinois Water Science Center | April 2012 - June 2017

Operationally focused scientist working on water resource problems in the Great Lakes region.

  • Designed & conducted novel hydraulic studies with hydroacoustics as part of the Asian Carp Program.
  • Evaluated new hydroacoustic sensors and technology through former Office of Surface Water.
  • Conducted & designed several national training classes & seminars on advanced use of hydroacoustics.
  • Recognized Subject Matter Expert on use of hydroacoustics in novel or atypical deployments.
  • Co-developed Velocity Mapping Toolbox software; a recognized standard application for use with hydroacoustics.
  • Completed fieldwork and scientific analysis for several projects as assigned.
hydroacoustics sediment transport geomorphology fieldworkf

Education / Training

University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

Doctorate of Geography, Minor in Civil and Environmental Engineering | September 2007 - May 2014

My research focused on deepening our understanding of the fluvial dynamics and geomorphology of river meander bends.
  • Article: Velocity profiles and the structure of turbulence at the outer bank of a compound meander bend. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.geomorph.2017.06.018.
  • Article: Three-dimensional flow structure and patterns of bed shear stress in an evolving compound meander bend. https://doi.org/10.1002/esp.3895.
  • Article: Interaction among Mean Flow, Turbulence, Bed Morphology, Bank Failures and Channel Planform in an Evolving Compound Meander Loop. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.geomorph.2001.05.026.

Texas State University-San Marcos

Master of Science in Geography | September 2005 - December 2007

Texas State University-San Marcos

Bachelor of Science in Physical Geography, Minor in Music | September 1999 - May 2005
